projects:
[{'title': 'Súd Ie en Wetterfront Dokkum', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'description': 'Verantwoordelijk voor het opzetten, plannen en uitvoeren van het monitoringsprogramma binnen het Sud Ie project. Hierbij onderzoeken we de effectiviteit van gerealiseerde vispassages en de verandering die dit teweeg brengt in het Sud Ie ecosysteem. Tevens onderzoeken we specifiek de paai- en opgroeigebieden langs de Sud Ie en welke verandering hier plaatsvind door de aanleg van een groot aantal vispassages.

Daar valt onder het opzetten, onderhouden en analyseren van een groot aantal monitoringscampagnes. Waaronder akoestische telemetrie en pit studies. Tevens ook de afstemmingen met een groot aantal projectpartners en belanghebbende.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jimmy', 'last_name': 'van Rijn', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Researcher at Van Hall Larenstein University of Applied Sciences'}]}, {'title': 'Vissen Voor Verbinding', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'description': 'Verantwoordelijk voor het opzetten, plannen en uitvoeren van het monitoringsprogramma op het Lauwersmeer. Daar valt onder het opzetten, onderhouden en analyseren van fuikmonitoring, saliniteit meetnetwerk, akoestische telemetrie netwerk en het zenderen van migrerende vissoorten. Tevens ook de afstemmingen met een groot aantal projectpartners en belanghebbende.

With the use of a private sailing yacht we ventured into the rarely explored waters of this region with the mission underwater-, photographic- and cultural exploration. Traveling through such remote areas with a bare minimum infrastructural of facilities made for fascinating challenges. Dependance for local trade for for daily vegetables and fruits, inventive boat repairs, independant diving operations, spear fishing for protein and navigation trough mostly unchartered waters. A valuable life/professional experience in many ways!', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jimmy', 'last_name': 'van Rijn', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Researcher at Van Hall Larenstein University of Applied Sciences'}]}, {'title': 'Technical Advisor', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'description': 'Technical advisor during the Conch Research Cruise in the Bahamas (June 2016). I was invited to join the Bahamas expedition and instruct the team on how to use and construct the towed video method for deep water Queen Conch surveys. Publication on the towed video method is in press.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jimmy', 'last_name': 'van Rijn', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Researcher at Van Hall Larenstein University of Applied Sciences'}]}, {'title': 'Independent reviewer for NOAA', 'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'description': 'Reviewed a research proposal', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jimmy', 'last_name': 'van Rijn', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Researcher at Van Hall Larenstein University of Applied Sciences'}]}, {'title': 'MSc. Biology thesis on fish ecomorphology on the Saba bank (Dutch Caribbean)', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'description': 'The effect of habitat type on the morphological diversity of reef fish assemblages of the Saba bank: combining stereo video assessments with the Fish Food Model (FFM)

The aims of this research are:
1.	Determining the fish community structure on different locations on the Saba bank with BRUV. For each species the relative abundance (MaxN) and fish length is measured and species richness is related to different sampling areas. Sampling areas are categorized in habitat types using a 6-point scale (A-F) to relate species richness to habitat type.
2.	For the top 15 fish species (families) occurring on the Saba bank, some of the 35 ecomorphological traits are obtained by dissection. With FFM (Sibbing and Nagelkerke, 2001) the species are classified in trophic groups according to morphological traits, based on their feeding strategies. The composition of trophic groups is analyzed per habitat type and differences are related between habitat types and fishing pressure.
3.	Fish community structures (trophic groups) on the Saba bank are obtained in areas with and without fisheries activity. In this way effect of fisheries on fish community structures (trophic groups) are analyzed. When present, further analysis of the data is done to establish the extent of the influence of fisheries on the community structures.
', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jimmy', 'last_name': 'van Rijn', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Researcher at Van Hall Larenstein University of Applied Sciences'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Kai', 'last_name': 'Wulf', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Parks Manager at Saba Conservation Foundation'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Twan', 'last_name': 'Stoffers', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Postdoc Freshwater Biodiversity at IGB Berlin'}]}, {'title': 'IWC/SPAW Workshop on Whale entanglements and disentanglement', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'description': 'We were trained by Dr Michael Moore (Woods Hole Oceano graphic Institution) in the forensic and practical criteria used to determine human impact (e.g. ship strike and entanglement) from stranded whales. Then David Mattila (IWC) and Doug Sandilands (PCCS) took over to inform and train them on the technical and safety procedures to disentangle large whales at sea. The second part of the training was conducted first in classroom, where participants were able not only to learn about how to assess an entanglement situation and how to intervene safely whenever possible, but also could share their own experiences and contexts with regard to regulations, agencies involved in disentanglements, etc. A series o f practical exercises took place on the water on the third
day, where participants grouped in teams of two, could in turns practice on the rescue boat, then watch others from the whale boat.
